numbered_ace_sentences: 1. I notice a pattern in the data.
2. There are few nations in which many adults are positive about the world's direction.
3. There are few nations in which many young adults are positive about the world's direction.
4. In many nations, adults and young adults are both positive about the future.
5. In many nations, adults and young adults are both not positive about the future.
6. In many nations, young adults are more positive about the future than adults.
7. I wonder whether older people are generally less optimistic than younger people.
8. I wonder whether a correlation exists between a nation's relative wealth and the positivity about the future in the nation.
9. This topic is relevant to me.
10. I enjoy thinking about complex questions.
11. Everyone thinks about such questions sometimes.
12. It is very important for our society to consider such questions.
13. The headline is: How positive are we about the world's future?
